Wait, people raw dog for recognition and bragging rights? I just do it to zone out and think about fantasy stuff. Like if I was a medieval king, and my army fought another army and won -- what do I do with all the enemies swords and gear? Do I smelt it down, do I reuse it?  \---  sometimes if I'm being cheeky I just stare at someone else's movie screen and wonder what's going on without audio. It's how I realized that Avatar 2 must be a really, really long movie.

No it's not optional when booking.    Not sure it's marketing -- I think it's a lingering result of that failed attempt by the now fired guy to set up the system where you wouldn't earn miles unless you booked directly on the AA site or through "travel partners". Since most business travelers book through a third party (e.g, via Concur connected to a travel agent), many of those agencies had to get set up as these travel partners and you would have to have the reservation marked as "business".  My "business" option actually lists the company name that I work for.
